title: Verify zero Elixir compilation warnings
description: QUALITY GATE: After all warning fixes, run 'mix compile --force 2>&1 | grep warning' and verify zero output. The todo-app must compile with zero warnings to meet 1.0 quality standards. This is the final verification before declaring warning-free compilation.

title: Fix @import module attribute never used warning
description: UNUSED ATTRIBUTE: lib/string_tools.ex:2 has '@import :Bitwise' module attribute that is set but never used. Either use it or remove. This is in the StringTools module generated from std. Check std/_std source for the Haxe origin.

title: Generate or implement TodoApp.Flash and TodoApp.FlashTypeTools modules
description: MISSING MODULES: Two related Flash modules are undefined. TodoApp.Flash has info/2, success/2, warning/2, error/3 used in FlashMapTools.get_all/1 (lib/phoenix/types/flash_map_tools.ex:6-9). TodoApp.FlashTypeTools has to_string/1 and from_string/1 used in Flash.to_phoenix_flash/1 and Flash.from_phoenix_flash/1 (lib/phoenix/types/flash.ex:19,23). These handle Phoenix flash message types. Implement in std/phoenix/types/ or todo-app src_haxe.

title: Fix @:application annotation to generate TodoApp.Application module
description:
TEMPORARILY RESOLVED with manual workaround - manual application.ex created.

The root cause is still unknown: OutputManager iterator loop traces show processing but post-loop code never executes. The manual application.ex unblocks development.

ROOT CAUSE INVESTIGATION STILL NEEDED:
- Debug traces show iterator processes module correctly
- But 'Files map ready' and 'Writing files' traces never appear
- Suspecting iterator loop throws/hangs after processing Application

WORKAROUND APPLIED: Manual lib/todo_app/application.ex created

PROPER FIX STILL REQUIRED: Investigate OutputManager.generateFilePerModule() loop completion

title: Fix handle_event catch-all clause unused params warning
description: UNUSED PARAMS: The catch-all handle_event/3 clause at TodoLive.ex:928 has unused 'event' and 'params' parameters. This is the fallback clause 'def handle_event(event, params, socket) do'. In Elixir, unused params should be prefixed with underscore. Fix in Haxe source or compiler to generate 'def handle_event(_event, _params, socket) do' for catch-all clauses.

title: Fix unused function warnings in TodoLive
description: UNUSED FUNCTIONS: Three private functions in TodoLive.ex are unused: render_todo_item/2 (line 590), render_tags/1 (line 668), is_optimistically_toggled/2 (line 275). Either: (1) These are dead code - remove from Haxe source, (2) DCE should eliminate them, or (3) They should be called somewhere. Investigate in src_haxe/server/live/TodoLive.hx and fix appropriately.

title: 1.0 Release: Todo-app compiles from Haxe to idiomatic Elixir with zero errors/warnings
description:
GOAL: Todo-app compiles from Haxe â†’ idiomatic Elixir without errors or warnings, and runs successfully.

DEFINITION OF DONE:
1. mix compile succeeds with 0 errors
2. mix compile succeeds with 0 warnings (or only acceptable framework warnings)
3. mix phx.server starts successfully
4. QA sentinel passes
5. Generated Elixir code is idiomatic (no machine-generated patterns)

BLOCKERS TO RESOLVE:
- P0: @:application not generating TodoApp.Application module
- P1: Missing modules (Flash, SafePubSub, Sorting, ChangesetTools)
- P2: Elixir compilation warnings (underscore variables, shadowing, unused params)

title: Run QA sentinel after critical fixes
description: VERIFICATION: After fixing haxe.elixir-4ql (Application module) and the missing module issues, run QA sentinel to verify the app boots: scripts/qa-sentinel.sh --app examples/todo-app --port 4001 --async --deadline 90 -v. The app should start without 'module TodoApp.Application is not available' error.

title: Generate or implement Phoenix.SafePubSub module
description: MISSING MODULE: Phoenix.SafePubSub has 5 undefined functions used in TodoPubSub (lib/reflaxe_runtime/server/pubsub/todo_pub_sub.ex): subscribe_topic/1 (line 9), broadcast_topic_payload/2 (line 13), parse_with_converter/2 (line 17), add_timestamp/1 (line 41), is_valid_message/1 (line 45). This is a type-safe wrapper around Phoenix.PubSub. Implement in std/phoenix/ or integrate into existing PubSub extern.

title: Fix Phoenix infrastructure module generation - @:application, @:endpoint, @:router, @:phoenixWebModule not generating proper modules
description:
## Problem
Phoenix infrastructure modules are not being generated despite having transformation passes defined. Currently requires hand-written workaround files.

## Root Cause
1. Missing isPhoenixWeb metadata flag in compileClassImpl
2. Missing shouldGenerateClass checks for @:endpoint, @:router, @:phoenixWebModule
3. Missing output path handling for these annotations

## Implementation Plan
- Phase 1: Add isPhoenixWeb metadata flag (ElixirCompiler.hx:2357)
- Phase 2: Add shouldGenerateClass checks (ElixirCompiler.hx:426)
- Phase 3: Add output path handling in setFrameworkAwareOutputPath()
- Phase 4: Verify transformation passes work
- Phase 5: Remove workaround files and test

## Files to Modify
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ElixirCompiler.hx
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/AnnotationTransforms.hx

## Validation
- _GeneratedFiles.json includes all infrastructure modules
- mix compile --force && mix phx.server works without workarounds

title: Fix app-level unused variables in TodoLive
description: APP-LEVEL WARNINGS: TodoLive.ex has many unused variables that should be fixed in the Haxe source (src_haxe/server/live/TodoLive.hx): raw_params_completed, raw_params_description, raw_params_due_date, raw_params_priority, raw_params_tags, raw_params_title, raw_params_user_id (in create_todo), broadcast_result, s_optimistic, broadcast, todo_updated, todo_updates (in toggle_todo_status), refreshed_todos, currently_selected (in handle_event). Either use these variables or remove/prefix them in Haxe source.

title: Run Playwright E2E tests after app boots
description: E2E VERIFICATION: After the app boots successfully, run Playwright tests to verify runtime functionality: BASE_URL=http://localhost:4001 npx -C examples/todo-app playwright test. Tests should verify: home page loads, todos list renders, CRUD operations work (add, edit, delete, toggle), search/filter works. All tests in examples/todo-app/e2e/*.spec.ts must pass.

title: Fix variable shadowing warnings in TodoLive
description: VARIABLE SHADOWING: Several variables trigger 'variable is unused (there is a variable with the same name in the context)' warnings: s_optimistic (line 110), value (lines 120, 150, 268), filtered_todos (line 588), tags_norm (line 671). These indicate variable shadowing issues where a new variable masks an existing one. Fix in Haxe source to use different names or pin operator.

title: Generate or implement TodoApp.ChangesetTools module
description: MISSING MODULE: TodoApp.ChangesetTools.cast_with_string_fields/3 is undefined. Used in TodoLive.create_todo/2 at lib/todo_app_web/todo_live.ex:82. Either: (1) Create a Haxe class in std that generates this module, (2) Add it to the todo-app src_haxe, or (3) Remove the reference if dead code. The function appears to handle casting changeset fields from string params.

title: Generate or implement Phoenix.Sorting module
description: MISSING MODULE: Phoenix.Sorting.by/2 is undefined. Used in TodoLive.filter_and_sort_todos/5 at lib/todo_app_web/todo_live.ex:723. This appears to be a sorting utility that should sort a list by a given key. Either implement in std/phoenix/ or remove reference if not needed.

title: Fix Type module stub functions with unused params
description: STUB FUNCTIONS: lib/type.ex has many stub functions with unused parameters generating warnings: typeof/1, enum_index/1, enum_parameters/1, enum_constructor/1, get_class/1, get_super_class/1, get_class_name/1, get_enum_name/1, is_type/2, create_instance/2, create_empty_instance/1, create_enum/3, create_enum_index/3, get_enum_constructs/1, all_enums/1. These are Haxe Type API stubs. Either implement properly for Elixir or prefix unused params with underscore.

title: Fix underscore variable usage warnings
description: UNDERSCORE VAR USAGE: TodoLive.ex:689,695 shows 'the underscored variable _this is used after being set'. In Elixir, underscore-prefixed variables should not be used after assignment. This happens in filter_todos/3 with String.downcase(_this). The compiler is generating underscore prefix but then using the variable. Fix the naming or usage pattern.

title: Fix unused variable warnings - add underscore prefix in compiler
description: COMPILER ENHANCEMENT: The compiler generates ~50+ unused variable warnings in Elixir. Variables like 'value', 'this1', 'e', 'o', 'c', 't', 'args', 'cl', 'constr', 'index' are declared but never used. Elixir convention requires prefixing unused variables with underscore (_value, _this1, etc). Fix in code generator to detect unused variables and add underscore prefix automatically. This is a systematic fix, not per-variable.
